<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/facebook-whistleblower-reveals-herself-to-be-former-product-manager-frances-haugen?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Blowing the Whistle on Facebook
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/facebook-whistleblower-reveals-herself-to-be-former-product-manager-frances-haugen?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Frances Haugen on 60 Minutes" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/717c2fe38ec47fdf6495e99ed38266f4330fc6e8-1838x1030.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>CBS News</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’ve been a loyal Brew reader, you know that in recent weeks Facebook’s been rocked by a huge leak of internal company documents.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night, in an <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/facebook-whistleblower-misinformation-public-60-minutes-2021-10-03/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview</a> on <em>60 Minutes</em>, the source of those leaks revealed herself: former Facebook product manager Frances Haugen.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Haugen, who worked for almost two years on Facebook’s civic misinformation team before leaving in May, said she became increasingly concerned that the company was prioritizing engagement over user safety and wellbeing. Two of her accusations that have made big waves: 1) that Facebook contributed to the Jan. 6 insurrection at the Capitol by allowing the spread of misinformation and 2) that it knew Instagram was harmful to teens’ mental health but didn’t take action.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Haugen was so concerned that she gathered reams of internal research and distributed them to folks who could do something about it.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Haugen sent those documents (tens of thousands of pages worth) to the WSJ, which published a series of investigations called the </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-facebook-files-11631713039?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Facebook Files</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>She also sent them to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and her lawyers have filed at least eight complaints that allege Facebook misled investors.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Facebook is blowing the whistle on Haugen</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company is going on offense to contain the fallout of a scandal that’s already bigger than the Cambridge Analytica data collection controversy in 2018.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before the interview aired, Facebook’s VP of Policy and Global Affairs Nick Clegg circulated a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/02/technology/whistle-blower-facebook-memo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1,500-word memo</a> to employees arguing that Haugen’s complaints are simply not backed up by the data. “What evidence there is simply does not support the idea that Facebook, or social media more generally, is the primary cause of polarization,” Clegg wrote.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>we’ll hear more from Haugen when she testifies before a Senate subcommittee on Tuesday.</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/big-spill-sends-oil-into-waters-off-the-coast-of-orange-county-california?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oil Spills and Water Don't Mix
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/big-spill-sends-oil-into-waters-off-the-coast-of-orange-county-california?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Crews clean up an oil spill in California" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/792f72c650e552e348205e5705f8b079a584ca54-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least 126,000 gallons of <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/major-oil-spill-washes-ashore-150103305.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spilled oil</a> has spread into a slick covering roughly 13 square miles off the coast of Southern California. It has the markings of a “potential ecological disaster,” Huntington Beach Mayor Kim Carr said, over fears the oil could harm local wildlife. The oil spill forced officials to close miles of beaches and cancel the final day of the popular Pacific Airshow yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It is one of California’s biggest oil spills in years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what caused it? </strong>A broken pipeline connected to the offshore Elly oil rig, Ocean County Supervisor Katrina Foley said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, oil stopped leaking from the pipeline, and now the race is on to prevent the worst environmental consequences. The Coast Guard helped build 2,050 feet of floating barriers to contain the huge oil slick from flowing into wetlands and other ecologically sensitive areas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Environmental leaders said oil spills, which are notoriously difficult to clean up, could be felt by local wildlife for years.</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/big-spill-sends-oil-into-waters-off-the-coast-of-orange-county-california&utm_source=facebook_share" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/opening-pandora-s-box-on-the-financial-secrets-of-the-global-elite?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Where the Global Elite Stash Their Cash
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/opening-pandora-s-box-on-the-financial-secrets-of-the-global-elite?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Cayman Islands " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/26d3ffb1706fbada4faf99e395d25a9624f0b265-4000x2250.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Photo by <a href="https://unsplash.com/@ronnyrondonph?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText">Ronny Rondon</a> on <a href="https://unsplash.com/s/photos/cayman%20islands?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText">Unsplash</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jordan’s King Abdullah II has spent <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2021/pandora-papers-offshore-finance/?itid=hp-top-table-high" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $100 million</a> on properties around the world, including a cliff-top mansion in Malibu. Czech Republic Prime Minister Andrej Babis used shell companies to buy a chateau in southern France for $22 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know this due to a huge trove of leaked private financial records that show how the top 1%, including billionaires and world leaders, use offshore accounts to evade taxes and conceal assets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These documents, called the “Pandora Papers,” represent one of the biggest leaks of financial information in history. The findings were published yesterday in a report compiled by 150 global media outlets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If that sounds like a lot of people working on this, it’s because there was an </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-business-religion-media-jordan-67b2674fc44fa543df49dfc8f52e29cd?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unprecedented amount of material</a></span><span>. Journalists had to sift through nearly 3 terabytes of data, equivalent to ~750,000 photos stored on a smartphone, per the AP.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The Pandora Papers are the sequel to 2016’s Panama Papers, financial records leaked from the defunct offshore law firm Mossack Fonseca. But yesterday’s report is on another level—records were collected from 14 offshore financial services providers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the impact of the new financial docs is still TBD. But at least in Pakistan, Prime Minister Imran Khan said his government will investigate the Pakistani citizens named in the documents.<br></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/key-performance-indicators-october-4?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Thanks to its App Store, Apple earned <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-doesnt-make-videogames-but-its-the-hottest-player-in-gaming-11633147211?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more profits</a> from games ($8.5 billion) than Microsoft, Nintendo, Activision Blizzard, and Sony <em>combined</em> in fiscal 2019, according to a WSJ analysis. But its role as gatekeeper of the gaming world is under threat as rivals like <em>Fortnite</em> maker Epic Games launch legal grenades.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You think people care what you think, and then you care less what people think, and then you realize no one cared, anyway.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tom-brady-speaks-his-mind-11632826511?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=top" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview</a> with the WSJ, Tom Brady shared one of his biggest learnings from getting older: Stop worrying about how people think about you, because they aren’t thinking about you. It appears to be working—Brady became the NFL’s all-time leading passer in his New England homecoming last night.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Watch: </strong>Love, hope, and worry in drought-ridden Page, Arizona. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/04/love-hope-and-worry-in-drought-ridden-page-arizona?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/key-performance-indicators-october-4&utm_source=facebook_share" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<a href="http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Apple's%20gaming%20profits%20dwarf%20its%20rivals'%20&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/key-performance-indicators-october-4&utm_source=twitter_share&via=morningbrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/the-week-ahead-october-4?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/03/the-week-ahead-october-4?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Supreme Court of the US" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e4e8fdcbf25ef918cc7cf700d2a680df1848e100-1200x800.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">SCOTUS is back: </strong>The Supreme Court <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/supreme-court-opens-new-term-with-masks-and-in-person-arguments-11633262400?mod=hp_lead_pos5" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returns today</a> to hear in-person arguments for the first time since March 2020. This fall is going to feature a blockbuster slate, with major cases over abortion, gun regulations, and religious expression.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>The August jobs report whiff raised concerns about the pace of the economic recovery. This Friday we’ll learn whether things picked back up on the hiring front in September. Only a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/01/october-may-have-a-bad-reputation-but-stocks-are-entering-a-normally-positive-period.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shockingly low number</a> of jobs added—like, zero—would delay the Fed from tapering its stimulus program in November.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech updates: </strong>Anyone else a proud green texter? The new Android 12 mobile operating system is expected to launch today, and Windows 11 is coming tomorrow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>No Time to Die</em></span><span>, the last Bond flick featuring Daniel Craig as 007, hits US theaters on Friday after earning an impressive $119 million overseas (without China).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After a wild weekend in baseball, the playoffs will start this week with two win-or-go-home Wild Card games: Red Sox vs. Yankees on Tuesday and Cardinals vs. Dodgers on Wednesday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s Nobel Prize week. The winner of the grandaddy of them all, the Nobel Peace Prize, will be announced Friday.</span></li>
</ul>
</div>

src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/717c2fe38ec47fdf6495e99ed38266f4330fc6e8-1838x1030.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’ve been a loyal Brew reader, you know that in recent weeks Facebook’s been rocked by a huge leak of internal company documents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast night, in an \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/facebook-whistleblower-misinformation-public-60-minutes-2021-10-03/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterview\u003c/a\u003e on \u003cem\u003e60 Minutes\u003c/em\u003e, the source of those leaks revealed herself: former Facebook product manager Frances Haugen.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHaugen, who worked for almost two years on Facebook’s civic misinformation team before leaving in May, said she became increasingly concerned that the company was prioritizing engagement over user safety and wellbeing. Two of her accusations that have made big waves: 1) that Facebook contributed to the Jan. 6 insurrection at the Capitol by allowing the spread of misinformation and 2) that it knew Instagram was harmful to teens’ mental health but didn’t take action.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHaugen was so concerned that she gathered reams of internal research and distributed them to folks who could do something about it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHaugen sent those documents (tens of thousands of pages worth) to the WSJ, which published a series of investigations called the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-facebook-files-11631713039?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFacebook Files\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShe also sent them to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), and her lawyers have filed at least eight complaints that allege Facebook misled investors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFacebook is blowing the whistle on Haugen\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company is going on offense to contain the fallout of a scandal that’s already bigger than the Cambridge Analytica data collection controversy in 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore the interview aired, Facebook’s VP of Policy and Global Affairs Nick Clegg circulated a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/02/technology/whistle-blower-facebook-memo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1,500-word memo\u003c/a\u003e to employees arguing that Haugen’s complaints are simply not backed up by the data. “What evidence there is simply does not support the idea that Facebook, or social media more generally, is the primary cause of polarization,” Clegg wrote.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ewe’ll hear more from Haugen when she testifies before a Senate subcommittee on Tuesday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt least 126,000 gallons of \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/major-oil-spill-washes-ashore-150103305.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espilled oil\u003c/a\u003e has spread into a slick covering roughly 13 square miles off the coast of Southern California. It has the markings of a “potential ecological disaster,” Huntington Beach Mayor Kim Carr said, over fears the oil could harm local wildlife. The oil spill forced officials to close miles of beaches and cancel the final day of the popular Pacific Airshow yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt is one of California’s biggest oil spills in years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what caused it? \u003c/strong\u003eA broken pipeline connected to the offshore Elly oil rig, Ocean County Supervisor Katrina Foley said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, oil stopped leaking from the pipeline, and now the race is on to prevent the worst environmental consequences. The Coast Guard helped build 2,050 feet of floating barriers to contain the huge oil slick from flowing into wetlands and other ecologically sensitive areas.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eEnvironmental leaders said oil spills, which are notoriously style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto by \u003ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/@ronnyrondonph?utm_source=unsplash\u0026utm_medium=referral\u0026utm_content=creditCopyText\"\u003eRonny Rondon\u003c/a\u003e on \u003ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/s/photos/cayman%20islands?utm_source=unsplash\u0026utm_medium=referral\u0026utm_content=creditCopyText\"\u003eUnsplash\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJordan’s King Abdullah II has spent \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2021/pandora-papers-offshore-finance/?itid=hp-top-table-high\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $100 million\u003c/a\u003e on properties around the world, including a cliff-top mansion in Malibu. Czech Republic Prime Minister Andrej Babis used shell companies to buy a chateau in southern France for $22 million.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know this due to a huge trove of leaked private financial records that show how the top 1%, including billionaires and world leaders, use offshore accounts to evade taxes and conceal assets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese documents, called the “Pandora Papers,” represent one of the biggest leaks of financial information in history. The findings were published yesterday in a report compiled by 150 global media outlets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIf that sounds like a lot of people working on this, it’s because there was an \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/entertainment-business-religion-media-jordan-67b2674fc44fa543df49dfc8f52e29cd?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunprecedented amount of material\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Journalists had to sift through nearly 3 terabytes of data, equivalent to ~750,000 photos stored on a smartphone, per the AP.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Pandora Papers are the sequel to 2016’s Panama Papers, financial records leaked from the defunct offshore law firm Mossack Fonseca. But yesterday’s report is on another level—records were collected from 14 offshore financial services providers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe impact of the new financial docs is still TBD. But at least in Pakistan, Prime Minister Imran Khan said his government will investigate the Pakistani citizens named in the documents.\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL
